name: The Opposite of Hitchcock Quiz | Movies Word Play | 10 Questions

questions.text: The opposite of this 1955 Hitchcock movie was "Release an Honest Person". What was the real title of this Hitchcock classic?
questions.explanation:
To Catch a Thief.

	Cary Grant and Grace Kelly starred in this romantic Hitchcock movie. Cary Grant was fifty when he took on the role of playing thirty-five year old cat burglar John Robie. Grace Kelly died in a car accident on the same road that was used in a car chase scene in "To Catch a Thief". The movie was based on a book by David Dodge of the same title. This was Grace Kelly's final Hitchcock film. She became Princess Grace of Monaco one year later and the citizens of Monaco disapproved of her starring as Marnie in Hitchcock's 1964 movie.

questions.text: Considered the first of Hitchcock's masterpieces, the opposite of this 1954 Hitchcock thriller was "Front Door". What is the actual title?
questions.explanation:
Rear Window.

	"Rear Window" was considered one of Hitchcock's finest mysteries. Jimmy Stewart played a voyeur stuck in his apartment because of a broken leg. While spying on his neighbors, he believed he saw one of them kill his wife. Hitchcock based the movie on a short story by Cornell Woolrich called "It Had to Be Murder". With this film, Mr. Hitchcock wanted his viewers to feel the imprisonment that Jeffries did as he only saw what was through his binoculars and nothing else outside his apartment building.

questions.text: The opposite title of Hitchcock's 1956 movie is "The Woman Who Didn't Know Anything". What is the proper title of this Hitchcock movie?
questions.correct: The Man Who Knew Too Much
questions.explanation:
The Man Who Knew Too Much.

	"The Man Who Knew Too Much" starred James Stewart and Doris Day as a vacationing couple whose son was kidnapped while they were overseas. In the movie, Doris sang the famous tune "Que Sera, Sera" earning the movie an Academy Award for Best Song. The 1956 version of "The Man Who Knew Too Much" was a remake of the original 1934 version.

questions.text: Hitchcock's most famous thriller had the opposite title of "Sane". What was the correct title of this Janet Leigh thriller?
questions.explanation:
Psycho.

	When the movie was first released to theaters, Hitchcock did so with the agreement that no one running late for the movie would be allowed to enter the theater after the movie began. "Psycho" was based on a novel by Robert Bloch. It starred Janet Leigh as a woman on the run who spent the night in the Bates motel and never left alive.

questions.text: A Hitchcock movie that Cary Grant starred in had the opposite title of "Trust". What was the correct title of this Hitchcock movie?
questions.explanation:
Suspicion.

	Joan Fontaine won an Oscar in 1941 for her role as Cary Grant's wife in "Suspicion". This was the only actress to win an acting award for a Hitchcock movie. The movie was based on the book "Before the Fact" by Francis Iles. Joan Fontaine starred as a woman who believed her husband was trying to kill her after her inheritance from her father turned out only to be a portrait.

questions.text: "The Correct Woman" was the opposite title of this jaw dropping 1956 Hitchcock movie. What was the correct title?
questions.explanation:
The Wrong Man.

	"The Wrong Man" with Henry Fonda was based on a true story of a man who was imprisoned for a crime committed by his look-alike. The movie contained a rare moment for Hitchcock in that it was the only movie in which he narrated the beginning of the movie.

questions.text: "Light of a Belief" was the opposite title of a 1943 Hitchcock movie. What was the real title?
questions.explanation:
Shadow of a Doubt.

	Alfred Hitchcock's wife helped co-write the screenplay for Hitchcock's favorite film. Teresa Wright starred as young woman who learned her favorite uncle was a killer.

questions.text: "Reputable" is the opposite title of Hitchcock's 1946 Cary Grant movie. What is the real title?
questions.explanation:
Notorious.

	"Notorious" was filmed in 1946 with Cary Grant and Ingrid Bergman as the title characters. Ingrid Bergman starred as a woman used by the FBI to gather secrets on her new husband. The Hitchcock movie was based on the short story "The Song of a Dragon" by John Taintor Foote.

questions.text: Cary Grant starred in this film with the opposite title "South by Southeast". What is the actual title of the Hitchcock suspense film?
questions.explanation:
North by Northwest.

	Cary Grant and Eva Marie Saint starred in this 1959 Hitchcock suspense thriller. "North by Northwest" was known as the Hitchcock picture to end all Hitchcock pictures. Cary Grant starred as a man being chased by government agents who believed he held secrets that could not be released to the public. The movie ended with a climactic scene on Mount Rushmore. Hitchcock was quoted in "Cahiers du Cinema" as saying the train entering the tunnel at movie's end was a symbol of Eva Marie Saint and Cary Grant's unseen love scene.

questions.text: "A Man Appears" is the opposite title of this Hitchcock thriller that takes place on a train. What is the correct title?
questions.explanation:
The Lady Vanishes.

	"The Lady Vanishes" was released in 1938 and starred Michael Redgrave and Margaret Lockwood. The movie centered around the disappearance of an elderly woman while on a moving train. It was Hitchcock's last movie filmed in the U.K. before he moved to the United States.
